sen.j: この制度が日本に伝わり、平安時代初期、紀伝道（文章院で漢詩文または歴史を学ぶ学科、通称は「文章道」）が盛んになると、文章博士（大学寮で詩文・歴史を教授した教官）が「策文」を出して文章得業生（もんじょうとくごうしょう）に答えさせる試験が行われるようになり、この試験が「対策」といわれるようになった。
sen.e: This program was introduced to Japan, and as Kidendo (called 'Monjodo', a department of Monjoin designed to study Chinese-style poems or histories) became popular in the early Heian Period, there started an exam that Monjo hakase (professor of literature and history at Daigaku-ryo (bureau of education under the ritsuryo system)) gave 'sakumon' to Monjo tokugosho and let them answer to this test, and this test was called 'taisaku.'
